Massachusetts General Laws Chapter 208 \.proposition: Pursuant to Massachusetts General Laws Chapter 208 § 28, this Court may modify a custody order upon a showing of a substantial and material change in circumstances warranting the modification in the best interest of the child.

Mason v. Coleman, 447 Mass. 177 (2006).proposition: In the case of Mason v. Coleman, 447 Mass. 177 (2006), the Supreme Judicial Court held that the relocation of a parent can constitute a substantial change in circumstances justifying a modification of a custody arrangement.
Mason v. Coleman, 447 Mass. 177 (2006).support_reasoning: The SJC in Mason v. Coleman addressed the standard for removal under G.L. c. 208, § 30 when parents share joint physical and legal custody, holding that ‘cause shown’ means a best-interests analysis in that context. The opinion does not frame relocation as a ‘substantial change in circumstances’ for purposes of modifying custody, nor does it adopt the ALI’s ‘substantial change’ language as Massachusetts law; that text appears only in a block quote describing the ALI Principles, not as the court’s own holding. Thus, the case does not stand for the proposition that relocation itself constitutes a substantial change justifying modification of custody.
Mason v. Coleman, 447 Mass. 177 (2006).relevant_excerpt:
The Principles of the Law of Family Dissolution § 2.17 (2002), as adopted and promulgated by the American Law Institute, state in pertinent part:
“(1) The relocation of a parent constitutes a substantial change in circumstances . . . only when the relocation significantly impairs either parent’s ability to exercise responsibilities the parent has been exercising or attempting to exercise [under the judgement of divorce]…”
… ALI Principles of the Law of Family Dissolution, supra at § 2.17 (1), (4) (c) … support the view that where “neither parent has been exercising a clear majority of custodial responsibility,” the effect of the relocation on the child is a “relevant factor[]” in determining the child’s best interests.
